quiz.title: Physics 11: Unit 3 Quiz 8
quiz.subtitle: Advanced Work, Energy, and Power
quiz.subject: Physics 11
quiz.topic: Work, Energy, and Power (Application & Problem Solving)

questions.question: A pump lifts 500 kg of water per minute from a well 15 m deep. What is the power output of the pump? (Take g = 10 m/s²)
questions.explanation: Power = Work/time = (mgh)/t. Mass per second = 500 kg / 60 s = 25/3 kg. Power = (25/3 * 10 * 15) = 1250 W = 1.25 kW.

questions.question: An electric motor has an efficiency of 80%. If it is rated at 2.0 kW, what is the useful power output?
questions.explanation: Useful Power = Efficiency × Input Power = 0.80 × 2.0 kW = 1.6 kW.

questions.question: A body of mass 2 kg is moving at 3 m/s. A constant force of 4 N opposite to its motion is applied until it stops. What is the work done by this force?
questions.explanation: Work-Energy Theorem: Work done = Change in KE. Initial KE = ½ × 2 × 3² = 9 J. Final KE = 0 J. Work = 0 - 9 = -9 J (negative as force opposes motion).

questions.question: A machine has a velocity ratio (VR) of 6 and is 75% efficient. What effort is required to lift a load of 180 N?
questions.explanation: MA = Efficiency × VR = 0.75 × 6 = 4.5. MA = Load/Effort → Effort = Load/MA = 180 N / 4.5 = 40 N.

questions.question: A bullet of mass 0.02 kg traveling at 200 m/s penetrates a wooden block and comes to rest after moving 0.05 m inside it. What is the average resistive force exerted by the block?
questions.explanation: Work done by force = Change in KE. -F × d = 0 - ½mv². F = (½ × 0.02 × 200²) / 0.05 = 400 / 0.05 = 8000 N.

questions.question: The graph of force (F) versus displacement (s) for an object is a straight line through the origin. The work done is represented by:
questions.explanation: For a force-displacement graph, the work done is given by the area under the graph, regardless of the shape of the line.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a unit of power?
questions.explanation: Nm and J/s are units of power (1 W = 1 J/s). Kilowatt-hour is a unit of energy (power × time), not power.

questions.question: A boy pulls a 10 kg sled 20 m across a level surface with a force of 30 N at 60° to the horizontal. What is the work done? (cos 60° = 0.5)
A 1200 W kettle heats 1.5 kg of water from 20°C to 100°C. How long does it take approximately? (Specific heat capacity of water = 4200 J/kg°C, ignore heat losses)
questions.explanation: Energy needed Q = mcΔT = 1.5 × 4200 × 80 = 504,000 J. Time = Energy / Power = 504,000 J / 1200 W = 420 s.

questions.question: A spring of spring constant 500 N/m is compressed by 0.1 m. The maximum speed of a 0.5 kg mass attached to it upon release is?
questions.explanation: Elastic PE = ½kx² = ½ × 500 × (0.1)² = 2.5 J. This converts to max KE: ½mv² = 2.5 → ½ × 0.5 × v² = 2.5 → v² = 10 → v = √10 ≈ 3.16 m/s.

scoreMessages.90: Outstanding! You expertly apply work-energy principles to complex scenarios.
scoreMessages.70: Very strong! You understand core applications. Review power efficiency and graphical analysis.
scoreMessages.50: Good foundation. Focus on the Work-Energy Theorem and unit analysis for power/energy.
scoreMessages.0: Practice the key formulas: W = Fd cosθ, P = W/t, Efficiency = (Useful Output/Input) × 100%.
